content:
"everything you experience is now" isn't a mindset, it's just a description of what you're currently experiencing. 

for example, there isn't a mindset that allows you to experience a future, that's an assumption you make about yourself. kind of like looking at a weather prediction and then saying "I can experience rain in the future". You're confusing the map for the territory because you cannot ever actually experience rain in the future.

The way you make plans about the future is the same way you always have, by thinking. The future is a plan you make in the present moment. Always has been. If you're experiencing the future, you're not actually in the future, because you would be currently experiencing that.
